channel.title: InternetNews Realtime News for IT Managers
channel.description: All the top news, features, analysis and insight into enterprise and Internet technology, geared for IT managers and delivered by the best in the industry.

item.title: Microsoft Inks UC Deal With Polycom
item.description: Under a multi-year agreement unveiled Monday, Polycom will begin shipping integrated unified communications solutions built on Microsoft's Communications Server 14.

item.title: IT Earnings Way Up at Job Site Elance
item.description: Google App Engine, HTML5, search engine optimization and social media marketing are among the fastest movers on Elance's list of hot job opportunities available online.

item.title: Google, Verizon Posit Net Neutrality Accord
item.description: The two Internet and communications giants have put aside their differences to hammer what could be a palatable legislative solution to the net neutrality brouhaha.

item.title: Tech Stocks Gain Despite HP's Plunge
item.description: HP investors had a bad day, but the rest of the tech sector fared well.

item.title: New Federal Data Breach Bill Debuts in Senate
item.description: The new bill is getting early support from prominent Democrats and could require enterprises meet tighter security measures and new notification rules.

item.title: Cisco Unveils Top 10 Web Malware Threats
item.description: Contaminated websites are still a threat, but Cisco's latest security report suggests that are plenty of other Web-borne malware scams that can cost you or your company dearly.

item.title: Microsoft Adds Single Sign-On to Azure
item.description: The latest update to Microsoft's Azure AppFabric cloud-computing platform includes support for a harmonized online identity with single sign-on support for multiple credential providers.

item.title: Cisco's CSO Details Security Approach
item.description: The chief security officer at Cisco, John Stewart, talks about the networking giant's new security initiatives and building the trust of IT buyers.

item.title: Adobe Hurries Patch for PDF Security Flaw
item.description: The vulnerability in Adobe Reader could give hackers control of a user's computer.

item.title: HP CEO Hurd Quits After Harassment Investigation
item.description: As the executive who oversaw its turnaround departs, the tech titan rushes to reassure customers and shareholders.

item.title: Will Anyone Care When Chrome Netbooks Ship?
item.description: Google's netbooks running its Chrome operating system may not be shipped this year and, unfortunately for Google, it might not make too much difference if they do.

item.title: FCC Drops Closed-Door Net Neutrality Talks
item.description: In the wake of reported sideline talks between two rivals, the FCC says it lacks a "robust framework to preserve the openness and freedom of the Internet."

item.title: Microsoft-Salesforce Deal: Who Won?
item.description: What's behind the settlement between a rising power in the cloud and software-as-a-service and software colossus Microsoft, which is trying to make its own inroads into the area?

item.title: GPL Enforcement Notches Another Victory
item.description: The license at the heart of many open source projects is amassing a winning record when it comes to successfully pursuing enforcement lawsuits.

item.title: Say What? The Week's Top Five IT Quotes
item.description: Google Wave crashes, fighting to keep mainframe skills alive, beware the Outernet and more.

item.title: New Security Features Planned for Firefox 4
item.description: A third beta of Firefox 4 is nearing release that will include significant security improvements as well as new features.

item.title: Another Laptop Theft Exposes 21K Patients' Data
item.description: Philadelphia's Thomas Jefferson University Hospital is in the process of notifying more than 21,000 patients that a stolen laptop has exposed some of their most sensitive personal information.

item.title: Oracle Hits to Road to Pitch Data Center Plans
item.description: Analysts see Oracle focusing on Sun hardware, the cloud and other topics where customers are looking for direction.

item.title: Microsoft Preps Array of Windows Patches
item.description: The upcoming Patch Tuesday roundup targets a handful of fixes for Windows, several of which impact all supported versions of the OS.

item.title: Microsoft Nears IE9 Beta With Final Preview
item.description: The software giant has begun shipping the last technology preview of the next version of Internet Explorer, IE9, before it issues the beta release of the new browser.
